text: Pagosa Springs High School is a public high school located in Pagosa Springs, Colorado. ==History== Pagosa Springs High School moved into their current building in 1998.http://pagosa.com/schools_public/ ==Athletics== ===Teams=== Pagosa Spring's athletic teams are nicknamed the Pirates and the school's colors are black, white, and gold. Pagosa Springs teams compete in the following sports: *Baseball *Boys basketball *Boys golf *Boys soccer *Cross country *Football *Girls basketball *Girls soccer *Swimming *Track *Volleyball ===State championships=== *Boys basketball **1960 Colorado Class B State Championshttp://duttoncreek.com/pagosa-basketball-wins- state/https://www.denverpost.com/2013/01/09/all-time-list-of-colorado-boys- high-school-basketball-champions/ **2013 Colorado Class 3A State Championshttps://www.denverpost.com/2013/03/16/pagosa-springs-shocks-kent- denver-to-win-3a-boys-basketball-title/ *Girls basketball **2015 Colorado Class 3A State Championshttps://chsaanow.com/2015-03-14/pagosa-springs-girls- hoops-closes-out-perfect-season-with-first-title/ ==Demographics== 69% of the student population at Pagosa Springs High School identify as Caucasian, 15% identify as Hispanic, 12% identify as American Indian/Alaskin Native, 2% identity as Asian, 1% identify as multiracial, 0.5% identify as African American, and 0.2% identify as Hawaiian Native/Pacific Islander. The student body makeup is 51% male and 49% female.https://www.usnews.com/education/best- high-schools/colorado/districts/archuleta-county-school-district- no-50-jt/pagosa-springs-high-school-3970/student-body ==References== ==External links== * Official site Category:Public high schools in Colorado
title: Pagosa Springs High School
